error

Class ErrorSimThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • error.ErrorSimThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ErrorSimThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Thread for the Error simulator, takes init input from the Error simulator then send the request to the server (continued communication with server thread).

    • Constructor Summary

      ErrorSimThread(java.net.DatagramPacket packet, java.util.Scanner reader)

    • Method Detail

      • editMode

        public byte[] editMode(byte[] msg,
              java.lang.String newMode)
        Edits the mode of the packet string by going to the 0 separating the file name and mode and replacing the mode with the new mode passed.
        Parameters:
        msg - Byte array of the original packet
        newMode - New mode to replace in the request packet
        Returns:
        Byte array of the new request message

      • bringError

        public java.net.DatagramPacket bringError(byte[] msg,
                                 java.net.DatagramPacket received,
                                 int port)
        Creates the error packet based of the user input mode that the thread should be running in. Edits the original packet to contain the error the user entered at thread creation.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message to alter for the error packet
        received - Original packet to alter
        port - Port to send packet to
        Returns:
        DatagramPacket with error

      • delayPacket

        public void delayPacket(java.net.DatagramPacket data)
        Delays the packet selected by creating a new thread to send the packet from delaying the send for 2 seconds.
        Parameters:
        data - DatagramPacket to delay the sending of

      • printErrorList

        public void printErrorList()
        Prints the UI menu to the screen for the user.

      • sendUsingSocket

        public void sendUsingSocket(java.net.DatagramPacket packet)
        Sends the packet passed using the normal socket if the Error Socket flag is not set. Uses the Error Socket if the flag is set and the packet is to be sent from an incorrect source.
        Parameters:
        packet - DatagramPacket to send from the socket

      • checkIfDone

        public boolean checkIfDone(byte[] buffer)
        Checks if the byte array is the last data packet to be sent.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Array of bytes that was passed to it 512 if the buffer was filled
        Returns:
        true if the buffer is smaller then 512

      • setMode

        public boolean setMode(java.lang.String input)
        Sets the mode for the thread operation. Checks the input String to see if the user entered a valid command and if so the mode is set and the packet count is reset.
        Parameters:
        input - User input string to check for mode
        Returns:
        true if user input was valid and mode was set correctly

      • recAndSend

        public boolean recAndSend()
        Method that receives a packet and sends it to the destination. Edits the packet to include an error if the packet number expected to be changed is the same as the amount of packets received and sent.
        Returns:
        true if there are more packets that should be received in the transfer

      • run

        public void run()
        Takes in information from the server thread, and passes it to the client and vice versa
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
